title: Applied Computing | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Earn Specialist Certificates to broaden your career prospects in IT. Stack them towards a degree in Applied Computing with our unique Competency-based Stackable Micro-credential (CSM) Pathway designed for working professionals.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses

Earn Specialist Certificates to broaden your career prospects in IT. Stack them towards a degree in Applied Computing with our unique Competency-based Stackable Micro-credential (CSM) Pathway designed for working professionals.

AI and Machine Learning, Data Science and Analytics, Computer Architecture, Computer Ethics and Privacy, Programming and Software Development, Networking and Security, User Experience Design, Cloud Computing, Competency-based Education
The Infocomm Technology sector in Singapore is undergoing rapid transformation, creating a pressing need for talented professionals who can thrive in this dynamic landscape.
To meet these demands, SIT's Competency-based Stackable Micro-credential (CSM) Pathway in Applied Computing is curated.

This programme helps you master the most sought-after competencies, whilst providing you with the unique opportunity of stacking the micro-credentials you've earned, alongside your past learning and industry experience, towards a Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing.
Designed to Empower Working Adults in Your Skills and Qualifications Pursuit
Develop in-demand competencies in software engineering, cloud computing, cybersecurity, and AI that employers are actively seeking
Maintain your full-time employment while advancing your skills with our blended learning model that combines the best of online and in-person delivery
Earn recognised Specialist Certificates with each micro-credential for immediate career impact, with the option to build toward a full degree in Applied Computing (Honours)
From financial assistance of up to 90% course fees subsidy from SkillsFuture, to career guidance from success coaches, we support your success
Begin your journey by choosing from 10 specialised micro-credentials that match your immediate career needs without committing to a full degree programme upfront
“I am grateful for this opportunity to be part of the CSM Pathway, and looking ahead, I am excited to continue growing in my career.”
Each micro-credential can be taken individually. Upon completion of each micro-credential, you will be awarded a Specialist Certificate.
Deep Learning Forecasting with Time Series Analysis*
Information Security Risk Management and Audit

Micro-credentials denoted by asterisk (*) are pending funding approval from SkillsFuture Singapore. If you are planning to stack to a degree, SSG funding is only available for up to five micro-credentials (i.e. 90 credits).
Why Choose SIT's micro-credentials and CSM Pathways?
Our programmes have a strong focus on industry-relevant skills and collaboration with industry partners.
This ensures that you are well-prepared for the demands of the IT sector.
Our "Learning by Doing" approach empowers you with real-world competencies with hands-on experience.
This enables you to apply skills and create value for both you and your employer readily.
Our unique degree pathway offers unparalleled flexibility through its stackable micro-credentials.
This allows you to tailor your education to your career needs whilst you build towards a degree.
Our team of qualified success coaches, alongside SIT Faculty, will provide dedicated support for your learning journey.
This ensures that you have the tools and guidance needed to succeed.
Hear from learners who have embarked on their journey in the Applied Computing CSM pathway.
A Specialist Certificate for each micro-credential will be issued to learners who:
Attend at least 75% of the course and
Undertake and pass all credit bearing assessments
You have the flexibility to convert to the direct honours degree programme via the annual admission cycle from March – May and stack your acquired micro-credentials to a
The conversion to the degree pathway will take into account other prior learning such as industry certifications or competencies acquired from work, providing you with credit or exemptions

You will be subject to SIT's tuition fees and may qualify for the Ministry of Education (MOE) tuition grant, based on eligibility criteria set by MOE. Please note that the SkillsFuture subsidy will no longer be applicable once you convert to the degree pathway
To switch to the degree pathway, you must pass at least one micro-credential (Foundation/Specialised) with a minimum grade of 'C' and meet the degree's eligibility criteria
Each micro-credential is valid for 5 years when used for stacking to a degree
Micro-credentials in Applied Computing, except those denoted by asterisk (*) are eligible for SkillsFuture funding of up to 90% course fees.
If you are planning to stack to a degree, SkillsFuture funding is only available for up to five micro-credentials (i.e., 90 credits).
Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents, and Long-Term Visit Pass-Plus (LTVP+) Holders
Singapore Citizen (Below 40) / Singapore PR / LTVP+ Holder
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
Can I apply for the degree programme at any time?

You may apply for the degree programme during the annual admission cycle from March – May. You must pass at least one Foundation or Specialised micro-credential with a minimum grade of 'C' and meet the degree's eligibility criteria.
for more information on the degree programme.
How does stacking to a degree work?

Our BSc (Hons) in Applied Computing degree (via the CSM Pathway) offers a flexible and modular structure comprising two foundational micro-credentials in Applied Computing, four specialised micro-credentials in key areas of the field, and two elective micro-credentials (or two specialised micro-credentials in its place).  Relevant micro-credentials that you obtain can be stacked progressively to complete this degree.

In addition to SIT’s micro-credentials, your pathway to a degree will also take into account other prior learning such as industry certifications or competencies acquired from work, which will provide you with credit or exemptions.
for more information on the degree programme.
Do I need to take micro-credentials in a particular order?

Although we provide a recommended study pathway for the degree programme, you are not required to take micro-credentials in a prescribed order. SIT will state the recommended baseline competencies that an individual should have before embarking on a micro-credential.
How long does it take to complete one micro-credential?
It takes one trimester (3+ months) to complete a micro-credential.
I'm interested in other areas of computing. Will you be offering other micro-credentials?
SIT regularly reviews its curriculum to ensure that it remains industry-relevant. We are looking to expand the list of micro-credentials.
What is the structure of micro-credentials?

Micro-credentials are largely taught asynchronously, which gives you the flexibility to learn whenever and wherever you choose. While each micro-credential combines online and in-person delivery, the learning activities vary for each micro-credential.
What is the role of the success coach in the micro-credential?
Success coaches will work with you to develop a personalised learning plan. They will provide you with a wide range of resources and support services to help you navigate your learning journey.
Am I guaranteed a place in the micro-credential upon registration?

Acceptance into the micro-credential will be determined by the Teaching Team and/or if you fulfil the assumed prior knowledge (if any) stated in each respective micro-credential’s webpage. Places are allocated on a first-come, first-served basis.
Are there any interviews or additional assessments as part of the admission process?
No, there won’t be any interviews or additional assessments. However, you would need to provide supporting documents listed in the application form for a smoother admission process.
Can I enrol in multiple micro-credentials at the same time?
It is not advisable to enrol in more than one micro-credential at any one time given the associated commitment and workload.
How will I be notified about the status of my micro-credential application?
You will receive an email notification from SIT
Are all micro-credentials subsidised by SkillsFuture Singapore?

The list of micro-credentials subsidised by SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG) will be progressively updated.  If you are planning to stack to a degree, SSG funding is only available for up to five micro-credentials (i.e. 90 credits).
What’s needed for stackable microcredentials toward a degree?
Forest Tan describes how to begin creating a flexible pathway where learners can accumulate microcredentials aligned to industry that can stack toward a degree.
How to coach in-employment lifelong learners for success
A team from Singapore Institute of Technology offers insights from working with in-employment learners who are seeking to upskill by studying for degrees.
The future of learning: How competency-based education is shaping skills development

As the shelf-life of skills shortens, it's time to rethink the traditional approach to upskilling. With competency-based education, employees are able to master the skills that directly impact their careers, and employers are able to assess competency accurately.
Designed for busy professionals and executives, our courses are designed for those with ambition to grow in their career. Discover new opportunities to explore and hone your craft with us.
Our portfolio of short SkillsFuture-funded courses will help you contextualise and apply concepts to tackle real-world challenges.
Whether you are looking to enhance your skills or explore new areas of expertise, our learning pathways provide the flexibility and recognition you need to succeed.
Advance your career with industry-recognised licences and certificates through preparatory courses or examinations.
Enhance your employability in new sectors or job roles through the SkillsFuture Career Transition Programme.

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
SIT reserves the right to make changes to published course information, including dates, times, venues, fees and instructors without prior notice.
